title: Evelyn Ng
text:
I am a fourth year Statistics and Data science major in UCLA. I love using data to find insights and help myself make decisions. On this website, you’ll find my academic achievements, projects, and skills in data analysis and machine learning. Feel free to explore my journey in the exciting world of data.

title: Project 1
text: This project is about understanding the factors that impact student performance. I analyzed data on study hours, past scores, extracurricular activities, and sleep patterns to see how they affect to academic success.

title: Project 2
text: This project explores how alcohol consumption, exercise, and music type affect reaction times in a virtual population known as “the Islanders.” We focus on these factors because alcohol can impair cognitive function, while exercise is known to enhance it. Additionally, different genres of music may influence mood and performance. Our goal is to understand how these elements interact and their overall impact on reaction times.

title: Project 2
text: This project explores how alcohol consumption, exercise, and music type affect reaction times in a virtual population known as “the Islanders.” We focus on these factors because alcohol can impair cognitive function, while exercise is known to enhance it. Additionally, different genres of music may influence mood and performance. Our goal is to understand how these elements interact and their overall impact on reaction times.

title: Project 2
text:
Methodology
We used a 2-factorial design to evaluate the effects of three factors: alcohol (no alcohol vs. 150ml vodka), exercise (no exercise vs. 1km run), and music (heavy metal vs. classical), each at two levels. Participants aged 20-40 were randomly assigned to one of eight treatment combinations, with baseline reaction times measured using a ruler test. After a 15-minute wait for the alcohol to take effect, we recorded changes in reaction times across all treatment combinations.
